e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it eliminates the inherent bias in reporting, fostering trust and integrity with investors. This transparency can help protect the company from potential legal issues and enhance its reputation in the long run. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the changes, the benefits of honest financial communication ultimately outweigh the risks.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and integrity, ensuring that all financial information reflects the true economic performance of the company. It should avoid misleading practices, even if they are well-understood by the investor community. Additionally, it's important to consider the potential impact on different investor groups, ensuring that all stakeholders, including retail investors, have access to clear and truthful information.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management team plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to minimize confusion, especially among retail investors. Additionally, I would inquire about any potential impact on stock valuation and what strategies will be implemented to reassure investors during the transition to the new policy.
